words.definition: Having greater than average height

words.definition: Of great significance or value
A set of connected things or parts forming a complex whole

words.definition: To make available for use; supply
To comprise or contain as part of a whole

collections.title: 20 ways of saying Good and Bad

words.definition: Extremely good; outstanding
examples: The food at that restaurant is excellent.
She did an excellent job on the project.

words.definition: Exceptionally good; remarkable
examples: The view from the mountain is outstanding.

words.definition: Extremely bad or serious
Very bad or unpleasant
examples: The traffic was awful this morning.

words.definition: Extraordinarily good or attractive
examples: We had a fantastic time at the party.

words.definition: Causing or likely to cause horror; shocking
Exceptionally clever or talented
Causing or involving great suffering, fear, or unhappiness
examples: I feel dreadful about what happened.

words.definition: Inspiring delight, pleasure, or admiration

collections.description: Learn alternative ways to express good and bad

words.definition: Excellent; wonderful (British slang)
Thank you; goodbye (British slang)
Friend; buddy (British slang)
A man; guy (British slang)
Very pleased; delighted (British slang)
examples: She was chuffed with her exam results.

words.definition: Utterly astonished; amazed (British slang)
examples: I was gobsmacked by the news.

words.definition: Extremely tired; exhausted (British slang)
examples: After the long walk, we were knackered.

words.definition: Devastated; extremely disappointed (British slang)
examples: She was gutted when she failed.

words.definition: Crazy; insane (British slang)
In a literal manner or sense; exactly
examples: The word is often misused in conversation.

words.definition: Regardless (considered nonstandard)
examples: Irregardless of the weather, we'll go.

words.definition: Causing nausea; sickening
Easily set on fire; combustible
To have an effect on; make a difference to
A change which is a result or consequence of an action
examples: The effect of the medicine was immediate.

words.definition: Not firmly or tightly fixed in place
Be deprived of or cease to have or retain something
Belonging to or associated with the person being addressed

collections.title: Why learning English is hard

words.definition: The way in which a word is pronounced
The process of writing or naming the letters of a word
Words that sound the same but have different meanings
examples: English has many homophones like 'there' and 'their'.

words.definition: Not following the normal pattern or rules
A person or thing that is excluded from a general statement
examples: There are many exceptions to English rules.
This is an exception to the rule.

words.definition: Bewildering or perplexing
examples: The rules are confusing for learners.

words.definition: Testing one's abilities; demanding
examples: Learning English is challenging but rewarding.

words.definition: Causing annoyance or upset because of inability to change something
examples: It's frustrating when you can't express yourself.
The irregular verbs are frustrating to memorize.

words.definition: Consisting of many different and connected parts
examples: The language has a complex structure.

collections.description: Words that explain why English is difficult to learn

collections.title: Trends #6

words.definition: Relating to or involving an image, video, piece of information, etc., that is circulated rapidly and widely from one Internet user to another
examples: The video went viral on social media.

words.definition: A person with the ability to influence potential buyers of a product or service by promoting or recommending the items on social media
examples: The influencer promoted the new product.

words.definition: A word or phrase preceded by a hash sign (#), used on social media to identify messages on a specific topic
examples: Use the hashtag #trending for more visibility.

words.definition: The practice of transmitting or receiving data, especially video and audio material, over a computer network as a steady, continuous flow
examples: Streaming services are very popular now.

words.definition: A digital audio file made available on the Internet for downloading to a computer or mobile device
examples: I listen to podcasts during my commute.

words.definition: Watch multiple episodes of a television program in rapid succession

collections.description: Current social media and internet trends

words.definition: To be extremely good or impressive; to defeat decisively
examples: Our team kicked ass in the competition.

words.definition: Someone or something that is very annoying or troublesome
examples: This traffic is a real pain in the ass.
He's such a pain in the ass.

words.definition: To work extremely hard
examples: I've been working my ass off all week.
She worked her ass off to get that promotion.

words.definition: A person who is irritatingly clever or sarcastic
examples: Don't be such a smart ass.
He's always being a smart ass in class.

words.definition: A stupid or foolish person
examples: Don't be such a dumb ass.
That was a dumb ass thing to do.

words.definition: To defeat or overcome someone or something decisively
examples: Let's go kick some ass in this game!
Time to kick some ass and take names.

words.definition: To stop being lazy and start doing something
examples: Get off your ass and help me!
It's time to get off your ass and find a job.
